verbs.description: platonize (third-person singular simple present platonizes, present participle platonizing, simple past and past participle platonized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To explain by, or accommodate to, the Platonic philosophy.
examples: Either Plato philonized, or Philo platonized

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To adopt the opinion of Plato or his followers.
examples: He platonizes , after the manner of Origen , in some parts of his writingsÂ ; yet he is cited by Athanasius as a witness of the Son's consubstantiality with the Father
